Currently when adding nodes to a cluster, the nodes' identity(existance,
owned by whom, etc) are checked twice, this patch checks it before action
execution.
Also, allow cluster member to be added to the cluster again, just updated
the cluster's status, don't do anything.

Change-Id: Id35aee58dcb3294bca0e38de7df023960ad1b5ec
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-16 07:46:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/bcb8ff37e486fab927e2ebcec1267e3fc1b3a6ab', 'message': 'Allow cluster member nodes to be added to the cluster

Currently when a node is owned by a cluster, it is not allowed
to be added to any cluster. If user tries to add it to any cluster,
even to its owner, he will get the same error message
"Nodes xx owned by other cluster, need to delete them from those
clusters first."This will confuse user.
Also there is a case when user adds two nodes to a cluster, one is
already owned by the cluster, and the other is an orphan, in this case
he will be rejected and nothing will be done.
So it's better to allow the cluster-member node to be added to the cluster
again, but if in the adding node list there are some nodes owned by other
clusters, we deny this action.

Change-Id: Id35aee58dcb3294bca0e38de7df023960ad1b5ec
Closes-bugs: #1506759
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-19 08:41:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/33d9f21d9ef699b6de15a7a0b37d8dece21b1597', 'message': "Revise cluster_add_nodes action's behavior

This patch fixes the error message of adding a node which
is already in a cluster(no matter the cluster is target cluster
or not).
Also modify the way of node properties validation(don't remove
an element in a list by loop)
Thirdly, delete some redundant codes.

Change-Id: Id35aee58dcb3294bca0e38de7df023960ad1b5ec
Closes-bugs: #1506759
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-10-20 02:43:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/15fc5e41a70c316a36f0a9ab16da63c3480e7c74', 'message': "Revise cluster_add_nodes action's behavior

commit_message:
Revise cluster_add_nodes action's behavior

This patch fixes the error message of adding a node which
is already in a cluster(no matter the cluster is target cluster
or not).
Also modify the way of node properties validation(don't remove
an element in a list by loop)
Thirdly, delete some redundant codes.

Change-Id: Id35aee58dcb3294bca0e38de7df023960ad1b5ec
Closes-bugs: #1506759

commit_message:
Adds documentation for consumer resource

Adds both the userguide and reference for consumers resource.
Currently only a register, delete and retrieve guide are
needed.

commit_message:
Add environments from manual cases in system tests

Environments configurations:
    - 1 Controller, 1 Compute, 1 Cinder on Neutron/TUN with Sahara
    - 1 Controller, 1 Compute, 3 Ceph, 1 Mongo on Neutron/TUN use Ceph
        Volume and Image with Ceilometer and Sahara
    - 1 Controller, 2 Compute, 1 Cinder, 3 Ceph, 1 Mongo on Neutron/VLAN
        use Ceph Image with Ceilometer
    - 1 Controller, 1 Compute, 1 Cinder, 3 Ceph on Neutron/VLAN use Ceph
        Image and Rados
    - 1 Controller, 1 Compute, 1 Cinder and Mongo, 2 Ceph on Neutron/VLAN
    use Ceph Image and Rados with Ceilometer

Change-Id: Ie60f8fafdc7580a621649e71823f611d97b6807d

commit_message:
Fix oslo.messaging+amqp1+dsvm to run from master

gate-tempest-dsvm-full-amqp1 ends up using oslo.messaging from
pip. We need a job that runs dsvm-full with oslo.messaging from git.
we reuse what was added for zmq in review:
If85ce9e4a6c976f30f29671e7d23eff784d0f5b8

and add the ostype parameter needed for the amqp1 job to run
only on fedora nodes

Change-Id: I40ac10040b9644cd74b4144fce77c34887f0f5b8

on new commits. It'll also validate that we can actually build the js
being submitted, which is something we're missing right now.

commit_message:
Make openstack-health npm lint job voting

We have finally gotten the lint checking into a good spot on
opnestack-health, so let's make the job voting so we're enforcing this
on new commits. It'll also validate that we can actually build the js
being submitted, which is something we're missing right now.

Depends-On: I3aa0c91e77f40c6383ac73850f5b93ebae9af323

Change-Id: Ie3d7326b8a3cc7f01d7ded174a0ac077e9695054

commit_message:
Add logs REST resource

Return dmesg and journal when requested from Ironic servers.

Change-Id: Iab6ba78d6c3f0f050c305c7e32222bffd0ee8a1f
Implements: blueprint deploy-agent-logging
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/37/163737/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 VA Linux Systems Japan # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import base64 import gzip import tempfile import pecan from pecan import rest from wsme import types from wsmeext import pecan as wsme_pecan from oslo_concurrency import processutils from ironic_python_agent.api.controllers.v1 import base from ironic_python_agent.openstack.common import log LOG = log.getLogger() class LogData(base.APIBase): dmesg = types.text journal = types.text @classmethod def logdata(cls): instance = cls() try: stdout, stderr = processutils.execute('/bin/dmesg') with tempfile.TemporaryFile() as compressed: gz = gzip.GzipFile(fileobj=compressed, mode='wb') gz.write(stdout) gz.close() compressed.seek(0) instance.dmesg = base64.b64encode(compressed.read()) except Exception, e: LOG.warn("dmesg failed %s", repr(e)) try: stdout, stderr = processutils.execute('/bin/journalctl') with tempfile.TemporaryFile() as compressed: gz = gzip.GzipFile(fileobj=compressed, mode='wb') gz.write(stdout) gz.close() compressed.seek(0) instance.journal = base64.b64encode(compressed.read()) except Exception, e: LOG.warn("journalctl failed %s", repr(e)) return instance class LogController(rest.RestController): """Controller for getting agent logs.""" @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(LogData) def get_all(self): """Get logs.""" agent = pecan.request.agent status = agent.get_status() return LogData.logdata()

commit_message:
Add device_owner while creating neutron port.

1. Set device_id to endpoint id
2. Set device_owner to kuryr:container

Change-Id: Ib080ee59f6428732f341167088a99f726ef74891
Closes-Bug: 1504001
Signed-off-by: Pengfei Ni <feiskyer@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add check-requirements job for python-scciclient

This patch adds check-requirements job for python-scciclient in order
add to the project 'python-scciclient' [1] into projects.txt [2]
in accordance with "Project Creator's Guide" [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-scciclient
[2] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/projects.txt
[3] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html

Change-Id: Id3d45b988cbdea6acd4eb909da93e65a5bc525fe

commit_message:
Write clouds.yaml to /etc as well

There are more than one user that need to access clouds.yaml values
in tests. Rather than copying the file everywhere, simply output
it to /etc/openstack.

However, we have things copying it at the moment, so output to
both places. A follow up patch will remove the homedir version.

Change-Id: I21d3c2ad7a020a5ab02dc1ab532feae70b718892
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/48/237148/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for clouds_path in /etc/openstack ~/.config/openstack ; do CLOUDS_YAML=$clouds_path/clouds.yaml mkdir -p $(dirname $CLOUDS_YAML) CA_CERT_ARG='' if [ -f "$SSL_BUNDLE_FILE" ]; then CA_CERT_ARG="--os-cacert $SSL_BUNDLE_FILE" fi $TOP_DIR/tools/update_clouds_yaml.py \ --file $CLOUDS_YAML \ --os-cloud devstack \ --os-region-name $REGION_NAME \ --os-identity-api-version 3 \ $CA_CERT_ARG \ --os-auth-url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI \ --os-username demo \ --os-password $ADMIN_PASSWORD \ --os-project-name demo $TOP_DIR/tools/update_clouds_yaml.py \ --file $CLOUDS_YAML \ --os-cloud devstack-admin \ --os-region-name $REGION_NAME \ --os-identity-api-version 3 \ $CA_CERT_ARG \ --os-auth-url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI \ --os-username admin \ --os-password $ADMIN_PASSWORD \ --os-project-name admin done
deleted_lines: CLOUDS_YAML=~/.config/openstack/clouds.yaml mkdir -p $(dirname $CLOUDS_YAML) CA_CERT_ARG='' if [ -f "$SSL_BUNDLE_FILE" ]; then CA_CERT_ARG="--os-cacert $SSL_BUNDLE_FILE" fi $TOP_DIR/tools/update_clouds_yaml.py \ --file $CLOUDS_YAML \ --os-cloud devstack \ --os-region-name $REGION_NAME \ --os-identity-api-version 3 \ $CA_CERT_ARG \ --os-auth-url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI \ --os-username demo \ --os-password $ADMIN_PASSWORD \ --os-project-name demo $TOP_DIR/tools/update_clouds_yaml.py \ --file $CLOUDS_YAML \ --os-cloud devstack-admin \ --os-region-name $REGION_NAME \ --os-identity-api-version 3 \ $CA_CERT_ARG \ --os-auth-url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI \ --os-username admin \ --os-password $ADMIN_PASSWORD \ --os-project-name admin

commit_message:
Support writing passwords to local.conf

localrc is deprecated for some time, but we still only try to write
passwords to this file.

Change-Id: I8d128eae97c6d0d8e347d1fe6f95b1e0a3d97fe5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/14/214714/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ -f $RC_DIR/local.conf ]]; then localrc=$TOP_DIR/local.conf elif [[ -f $RC_DIR/localrc ]]; then echo "This value will be written to your local.conf file so you don't have to enter it "
deleted_lines: if [[ -f $RC_DIR/localrc ]]; then echo "This value will be written to your localrc file so you don't have to enter it "

commit_message:
Add compute personality feature config

Add personality config in compute-feature-enabled.
Remove using personality in general tests.
Add some tests to test_server_pesonality.
Change tests with personality to skip if disable.

commit_message:
devstack: fix debug info for Gnocchi

Currently the gate job fails with:

2015-10-12 12:05:42.435 | * Unprocessed measures:
2015-10-12 12:05:42.448 | find: `/measures': No such file or directory

Because we didn't source the Gnocchi settings.

Change-Id: I35f2ea0d23a38d1cb514db72c2fe4bdf41c06f29

commit_message:
Make docstring of servers consistent

Docstring of service clients is very inconsistent, but we have a
plan to use it for generating API doc.
This patch makes docstring of servers consistent for fitting to
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html
as a first step.

Change-Id: Icb51c2cf189fc17a91dcac5b95dc4a27afeac543

subject: Improvements to the blueprint management process
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-16 00:36:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/875955312b16695404a3f26828eb5a3211d4dc63', 'message': "Improvements to the blueprint management process

It is easy to oversubscribe ourselves during a release
cycle. We approve specs only to experience that we fail
to review consistently; code is posted last minute,
we get lost into chasing race conditions, the odd dependency
throws the gate under the bus, and the ever-present cosmetic
refactoring patch steers our attention from what matters,
which is *reviewing what we commit to deliver*.

In order to keep ourselves focused on the bigger picture,
this patch proposes/formalizes changes to the way we
register blueprints so that we can improve our ability
to better foresee what we'll deliver at the end of a
release.

We obviously can't predict the future or chain people
to a desk, but a regular pulse check of a well planned
task list should at least help mitigate the feeding frenzy
that usually happens closer to FF. That inevitably
leads to half-baked and buggy solutions.

This patch also fixes minor bitrot due to lack of validation
(because of bug #1496882). In this case the fact that links
were broken down along multiple lines caused the errors.

commit_message:
Improvements to the blueprint management process

It is easy to oversubscribe ourselves during a release
cycle. We approve specs only to experience that we fail
to review consistently; code is posted last minute,
we get lost into chasing race conditions, the odd dependency
throws the gate under the bus, and the ever-present cosmetic
refactoring patch steers our attention from what matters,
which is *reviewing what we commit to deliver*.

In order to keep ourselves focused on the bigger picture,
this patch proposes/formalizes changes to the way we
register blueprints so that we can improve our ability
to better foresee what we'll deliver at the end of a
release.

We obviously can't predict the future or chain people
to a desk, but a regular pulse check of a well planned
task list should at least help mitigate the feeding frenzy
that usually happens closer to FF. That inevitably
leads to half-baked and buggy solutions.

Change-Id: Ia27b2a779204bf98c1dec2a30d00507de285f801
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/40/235640/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-specs>`_ repository for itsThe Neutron team does not enforce deadlines for specs. These can be submitted throughout the release cycle. The drivers team will review this on a regular basis throughout the release, and based on the load for the milestones, will assign these into milestones or move them to the backlog for selection into a future release. and consistency across the various fields required during the blueprint registration process (Approver, Drafter, etc.). More precisely, the blueprint submitter will work with the RFE submitter to identify the following: * Drafter: who is going to submit and iterate on the spec proposal; he/she may be the RFE submitter. * Assignee: who is going to develop the bulk of the code, or the go-to contributor, if more people are involved. Typically this is the RFE submiter, but not necessarily. * Approver: a member of the Neutron core team who can commit enough time during the ongoing release cycle to ensure that code posted for review does not languish, and that all aspects of the feature development are taken care of (client, server changes - and infra support if needed), as well as comprehensive testing. Approver `assignments <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+assignments>`_ must be carefully identified to ensure that no-one overcommits. A Neutron core develops code himself/herself, and if he/she is an approver of more than a couple of blueprints in a single cycle/milestone (depending on the complexity of the spec), he/she is clearly oversubscribed. The Neutron team will review the status of blueprints targeted for the milestone during their weekly meeting to ensure a smooth progression of the work planned. For this reason, attendance by Approvers is strongly recommended. Missing your target ------------------- There are occasions when a spec will be approved and the code will not land in the cycle it was targeted at. For these cases, the work flow to get the spec into the next release is as follows: * The PTL will create a <release>-backlog directory during the RC window and move all specs which didn't make the <release> there. * Anyone can propose a patch to neutron-specs which moves a spec from the previous release into the new release directory. The specs which are moved in this way can be fast-tracked into the next release. Please note that it is required to re-propose the spec for the new release however.
deleted_lines: <http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-specs>`_ repository for it'sThe Neutron team does not enforce deadlines for specs and blueprints. These can be submitted throughout the release cycle. The drivers team will review this on a regular basis throughout the release, and based on the load for the milestones, will assign these into milestones or move them to the backlog for selection into a future release.Neutron BP and Spec Notes ------------------------- There are occasions when a spec will be approved and the code will not land in the cycle it was targeted at. For these cases, the work flow to get the spec into the next release is as follows: * The PTL will create a <release>-backlog directory during the RC window and move all specs which didn't make the <release> there. * Anyone can propose a patch to neutron-specs which moves a spec from the previous release into the new release directory. The specs which are moved in this way can be fast-tracked into the next release. Please note that it is required to re-propose the spec for the new release however. and consistency accross the various fields required during the blueprint registration process (Approver, Drafter, etc.).

commit_message:
Register oslo_service.wsgi options correctly

oslo_service 0.10.0 release added register_opts function to wsgi
module that is why it is no longer needed to access its private
_options module.

Change-Id: I4803a3540a6bc9c8f08db49e209668d0736abec7
Depends-On: Id0f9f93758c68aa954d37e3566e35deae2961268

commit_message:
Zone placement policy

This patch proposes a placement policy that spreads nodes across
availability zones based on the (default) weights of each zone. The zone
assignment is passed via node.data to profile layer and then to the nova
driver.

Change-Id: I0e10e13ef7d69fbdb837612df99efdbfdf9e4322
Co-Authored-By: Qiming Teng (tengqim@cn.ibm.com)
                Cindia-blue (lxinhui@vmware.com)

commit_message:
Do not remove mapping if hdisk discovery fails

If the hdisk discovery fails with unknown udid, in that case
device name exist and udid is none, in that case connect volume
fails and no mappings are done, so during disconnect_volume we
should not try to remove the mappings for devices with unknown
udid.

Change-Id: If50b8d9cf7625d12afaeb76d6b7136262638a900
Closes-Bug: #1505388

commit_message:
WIP: N-Port Login changes for attach on shutoff VM

When attach request is made on VM which are in Powered off state
we need to temporarily Logged in the NPIV WWPNs to ensure proper
zoning on the fabric.

Change-Id: I12dfab58bcabe031510f022b8eeaf8ee42541e76
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/50/234750/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.compute import power_statefrom nova_powervm.virt.powervm import vmFS_VFC_LOGIN = 'vfc_port_login' def _is_inactive_fabric(self, fc_state, fabric): """Determines if the WWPN call for power-off instance. Since instance is power-off the instance WWPNs are inactive in such case mapping for the fabric needs to be created with the management partition. :param fc_state: The fabrics state. :param fabric: The name of the fabric. :return: True if the instance is powered-off and fc_state is mapped False otherwise. """ if (fc_state == FS_INST_MAPPED and self.instance.power_state == power_state.SHUTDOWN): LOG.info(_LI("Instance %(inst)s found in Power-Off state, Mapping " "for fabric %(fabric)s with the management " "partition "), {'inst': self.instance.name, 'fabric': fabric}) return True return False elif self._is_inactive_fabric(fabric, fc_state): vm.power_on_vfcs(self.adapter, self.instance) self._set_fabric_state(fabric, FS_VFC_LOGIN) port_maps = self._get_fabric_meta(fabric) # if the fabric state is currently set as VFC port logged in then # logout the NPIV ports. elif self._get_fabric_state(fabric) == FS_VFC_LOGIN: vm.power_off_vfcs(self.adapter, self.instance)

commit_message:
Attach volume for power-off instances

For power-off instance the WWPNs are not logged in, hence the
volume attachment fails to fetch the fabric information. So the
proposed changes handle this scenario by creating the vfc_mappings
with the management partitions if the instance if power-off during
attach volume request.

Change-Id: I881a93ae10a709733b57c162e6ae79105c29a967
Closes-Bug: #1503797
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/53/232453/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.compute import power_state def _is_inactive_wwpn(self, fc_state, fabric): """Determines if the WWPN call for power-off instance. Since instance is power-off the instance WWPNs are inactive in such case mapping for the fabric needs to be created with the management partition. :param fc_state: The fabrics state. :param fabric: The name of the fabric. :return: True if the instance is powered-off and fc_state is mapped False otherwise. """ if (fc_state == FS_INST_MAPPED and self.instance.power_state == power_state.SHUTDOWN): LOG.info(_LI("Instance %(inst)s found in Power-Off state, Mapping " "for fabric %(fabric)s with the management " "partition "), {'inst': self.instance.name, 'fabric': fabric}) return True return False if (self._is_initial_wwpn(fc_state, fabric) or self._is_inactive_wwpn(fc_state, fabric)):

commit_message:
Shared File Systems admin guide: remove local type of share network

A valid value of the network_type is VLAN, VXLAN, GRE, or flat.
The 'local' value was removed.

Change-Id: I86b51dbe37a6aa39ecc06362ae567a0a04f92df5
Closes-Bug: #1507626

subject: Fix devuser pubkey defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-14 00:53:06.000000000', 'files': ['elements/devuser/extra-data.d/50-devuser'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/a6e6570102b1d060b81ca4b571fcd4428a2c4f54', 'message': 'Fix devuser pubkey defaults

Without this patch, the devuser element attempts to find public keys by
iterating over the string "rsa dsa". When two keys are grouped together
in quotes, a bash for loop treats it as a single key. You can see the
issue this causes when debug output is turned on:

   + for fmt in '"rsa dsa"'
   + '[' -f '/home/krinkle/.ssh/id_rsa dsa.pub' ']'

This is not a reasonably named key to look for, so this patch removes
the quotes so that the loop will look for id_rsa.pub and id_dsa.pub
separately.

Change-Id: I0b5b1abd14013de85d90e76a95918a8071a5e013
'}]
commit_message:
Fix devuser pubkey defaults

Without this patch, the devuser element attempts to find public keys by
iterating over the string "rsa dsa". When two keys are grouped together
in quotes, a bash for loop treats it as a single key. You can see the
issue this causes when debug output is turned on:

   + for fmt in '"rsa dsa"'
   + '[' -f '/home/krinkle/.ssh/id_rsa dsa.pub' ']'

This is not a reasonably named key to look for, so this patch removes
the quotes so that the loop will look for id_rsa.pub and id_dsa.pub
separately.

Change-Id: I0b5b1abd14013de85d90e76a95918a8071a5e013
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/90/234490/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for fmt in rsa dsa; do

commit_message:
Don't run dsvm tests on rst/unit test changes

If the change is only for rst file or unit test on tempest-lib, don't
run the dsvm changes for avoiding much test operation time.

Change-Id: I8797171640f05c2b04c4299fa2c05ba25684e2de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/50/234550/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ensure replication functions check driver status

This patch adds the missing checks to ensure
the driver's are initialized to both
enable_replication and disable_replication.

This patch also adds comment blocks to the
failover_replication as well as list_replication_targets
functions to explain why they are both are not
checking the driver for initialization.  One of the main
use cases for those 2 functions happen precisely when the
driver can't talk to the primary backend, but might be
able to talk to the secondary or target backends.

Change-Id: I4052e0ff4d2977ecfba940db56dba24c063bbbb6
Closes-Bug: #1501936

commit_message:
Disable tacker dsvm functional test on kilo branch

Tacker kilo branch doesn't support the current devstack
functional tests. Disable the test for patchsets to
stable/kilo branch.

Change-Id: I6fabde81c9ec5e0eac7231104f39a40dee5efc6b
Closes-Bug: 1504845

commit_message:
[sitemap] if last-modified not set in header use current date

This solves the following issue when last-modified is not set in the
response header:

---snip---
KeyError: 'Last-Modified'
---snap---

Change-Id: I372f9638f6b5006ff250b9dbe0e75cc1556d18c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/32/235732/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if 'Last-Modified' in response.headers: timestamp = response.headers['Last-Modified'] else: timestamp = response.headers['Date'] lastmod = time.strptime(timestamp, "%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S %Z")

commit_message:
Python 3: encode or decode i/o data of Popen.communicate()

In Python 3, input and output for Popen.communicate() is bytes type.
Therefore, encode input data and decode return data for Popen.communicate().

Change-Id: Id6d85eea4c771ac9756ef08ba80ebc09005fcc3e
Related Change-Id: I70f009e3366f0eeda5790652ea14f3627b934664
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.rootwrap refs/changes/08/230408/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six if six.PY3 and isinstance(stdin, str): stdin = stdin.encode(encoding='utf-8') if six.PY3: if isinstance(out, bytes): try: out = out.decode(encoding='utf-8') except UnicodeError: pass if isinstance(err, bytes): try: err = err.decode(encoding='utf-8') except UnicodeError: pass

commit_message:
Added periodic job for OpenStack-Ansible

This change adds a new job to test Kilo to Juno upgrades for
Openstack-Ansible and adds a new periodic job handler to zuul which
will notify the openstack-ansible mailing list on failure.

Note: this change will require the system-config entry for the
mailing list to merge for us to be able to recieve failure
notices. Pending review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/224203

Change-Id: Ie9ee786d8cea9d34e2e0c2f669fd026abebed9d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/15/224215/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: periodic-openstack-ansible description: Periodic jobs for the OpenStack Ansible team. manager: IndependentPipelineManager source: gerrit precedence: low trigger: timer: - time: '3 6 * * *' failure: smtp: from: jenkins@openstack.org to: openstack-ansible@lists.openstack.org subject: 'Periodic jobs for {change.project} failed' periodic-openstack-ansible: - upgrade-juno-kilo-openstack-ansible-dsvm

commit_message:
Sets upper boundaries for all of the oslo packages

This change to stable/liberty was in response to quite a few 
oslo releases that have caused deployment and stability issues.

Example error: http://bit.ly/1WYvfrM

The change sets the upper boundaries to ensure release 
stability

Change-Id: I9670c00a8cdfdc96687941d7083527bb5b55d6ee
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Preserve network interfaces order of vnfd template

The Python dictionary behavior of vnfd body does not guarantee the
network interfaces to be fetched in same order as specified in template.
This fix uses the third party python package tosca-parser to preserve
the order. This will ensure the interfaces come up in the same sequence
as specified in template.

Closes-Bug: #1504687
Change-Id: Ieddd2ba16328869cef901d94bb53dc9566c250df

commit_message:
puppet: retire beaker-upgrade jobs

beaker-upgrade jobs was really experimental and until now it never
really helped us in our CI & review process.

In the next cycle, we will push CI efforts to test OpenStack upgrades
with Puppet, but we don't know yet if it will be with Beaker or another
tool (our integration jobs are running in bash).

In the meantime, let's retire the jobs which are now useless.
They don't get attention and are quite unstable.

Change-Id: If2372fc3382d329ae7cff57b61f15f8d17083721

subject: Merge tag '0.1.0'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-19 23:36:02.000000000', 'files': ['.gitreview', 'setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/searchlight/commit/f833723a0d2580132e980c62165dcabb13da9751', 'message': "Merge tag '0.1.0'

This is a null-merge of the 0.1.0 release tag back into the master
branch so that the 0.1.0 tag will appear in the git commit history of
the master branch. It contains no actual changes to the master branch,
regardless of how our code review system's UI represents it. Please
ask in #openstack-infra if you have any questions, and otherwise try
to merge this as quickly as possible to avoid later conflicts on the
master branch.

Change-Id: I57e51262f64fab548375be61ab0f95d60c359cb6
"}]
commit_message:
Merge tag '0.1.0'

This is a null-merge of the 0.1.0 release tag back into the master
branch so that the 0.1.0 tag will appear in the git commit history of
the master branch. It contains no actual changes to the master branch,
regardless of how our code review system's UI represents it. Please
ask in #openstack-infra if you have any questions, and otherwise try
to merge this as quickly as possible to avoid later conflicts on the
master branch.

Change-Id: I57e51262f64fab548375be61ab0f95d60c359cb6

commit_message:
Add flake8 to requirements

flake8 is called directly by dib-lint, so this is a hard requirement
to be installed for dib-lint to work outside of tox.  This came up
when proposing a dib-lint job for the nodepool elements in
project-config (I28459a9bbaaa6175d03dbe753498849a75942538)

Change-Id: I3052f860cebc66844cd21f34be64aea8474d2248

commit_message:
Update nova::db class to match other module pattern

This review aims to update the nova::db class to standardize it with the
other modules db classes[1][2]. It now offers the same parameters to customize
database connection behavior.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-neutron/blob/master/manifests/db.pp
[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-sahara/blob/master/manifests/db.pp

Change-Id: Ief978cd20a95c1ccafb7853ec8d5eb5d71513f7a

commit_message:
Move murano installation to plugin way

Jobs affected:
- gate-murano-devstack-dsvm
- gate-muranoclient-dsvm-function
- gate-murano-congress-dsvm

Builder affected:
- devstack-murano-rally-gate

Job gate-murano-devstack-dsvm disabled for stable/juno

Change-Id: Ic05230674455b0813619db79b279c1f37226fc45

commit_message:
Remove POSIX users, groups, and file modes.

This patch removes the File resources of nova.conf for mode, user and
group which should be delivered by packaging tools.  These resources
(mode, user, and group attributes) could be in conflict with different
OS packaging systems which isn't a desired result.

Change-Id: I4fac32742dc317b16a6af825ad7095f0d94f3e57
Closes-Bug: #1458915

commit_message:
Introduce keystone::db class

Current modules[1][2][3] implements a
<component>::db class that is not implemented in keystone.

This commit aims to apply here the same logic.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/master/manifests/db.pp
[2]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-designate/blob/master/manifests/db.pp
[3]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceilometer/blob/master/manifests/db.pp

Change-Id: Ifb868c101dd516eda7b9826e0faf33c3bc296e02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/94/208394/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'keystone::db' do shared_examples 'keystone::db' do context 'with default parameters' do it { is_expected.to contain_keystone_config('database/connection').with_value('sqlite:////var/lib/keystone/keystone.sqlite') } it { is_expected.to contain_keystone_config('database/idle_timeout').with_value('200') } end context 'with specific parameters' do let :params do { :database_connection => 'mysql://keystone:keystone@localhost/keystone', :database_idle_timeout => '201', } end it { is_expected.to contain_keystone_config('database/connection').with_value('mysql://keystone:keystone@localhost/keystone') } it { is_expected.to contain_keystone_config('database/idle_timeout').with_value('201') } end context 'with incorrect database_connection string' do let :params do { :database_connection => 'redis://keystone:keystone@localhost/keystone', } end it_raises 'a Puppet::Error', /validate_re/ end end context 'on Debian platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'Debian' } end it_configures 'keystone::db' end context 'on Redhat platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'RedHat' } end it_configures 'keystone::db' end end

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated tempest options

With the merge of 'Deprecate credential config options' in tempest,
(Change-Id: Ia5132c5cb32355d6f26b8acdd92a0e55a2c19f41)
admin credentials options have been moved from [identity] group to
[auth] group in tempest/config.py. This makes no difference for cinder
tempest tests.  However manila has separate tempest tests and
in manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/base.py, BaseSharesAdminTest always
gets admin credentials from identity group. It will fail with the
changed configuration options.

Closes-Bug: #1504052
Change-Id: If329a6563df2028a18c3fedea53065688e75339e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/50/232450/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if hasattr(CONF.identity,'admin_username'): cls.username = CONF.identity.admin_username cls.password = CONF.identity.admin_password cls.tenant_name = CONF.identity.admin_tenant_name else: cls.username = CONF.auth.admin_username cls.password = CONF.auth.admin_password cls.tenant_name = CONF.auth.admin_tenant_name

commit_message:
Integration tests - Instances tests

Added instancespage based on the new regions.
test_instances checks the instance createion and deletion.

Few other modifications I've made:
* forms:
- removed "div >" from checkbox locator, to identify "default" checkbox in
  "launch_instance->Access & Security ->default"
*horizon.conf
- Added [launch_instances] to include instances attributes from config file
*config
- Added InstancesGroup to include [launch_instances] from horizon.conf

Partially implements blueprint: integration-tests-hardening

Change-Id: I7d58a970fd36ff86021f3f050c5d01586a26599c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/91/117091/25 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests import helpers import datetime instances_availability_zone = 'nova' instances_flavor = 'm1.micro' instances_boot_source = 'Boot from image' instances_image_name = 'cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-uec (24.0 MB)' keypair_name = 'Instance_'+str(datetime.datetime.now(). strftime("%Y%m%d%H%M%S")[2:]) instances_attributes = {'availability_zone': instances_availability_zone, 'flavor': instances_flavor, 'boot_source': instances_boot_source, 'image_name': instances_image_name, 'keypair': keypair_name } class Test_Instances(helpers.TestCase): """This is a basic scenario to test: * login as a regular user * Perform Actions on Instances e.g.: Edit Instance, Pause Instance etc... """ def test_create_instance(self): """tests create instance: * Creates keypair * Creates and verifies Instance * Terminates and verifies Instance * Terminates keypair """ accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() keypair_page = accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.create_keypair(keypair_name) instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_instances_page() self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.create_instance( **instances_attributes) instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertTrue(instance_status) self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.terminate_instance() instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertFalse(instance_status) accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.delete_keypair(keypair_name) self.assertFalse(keypair_page.get_keypair_status(keypair_name)) def test_floating_ip_instance(self): """tests floating ip for instance: * Creates keypair * Creates and verifies Instance * Associate and Disassociate Floating IP and verifies * Terminates and verifies Instance * Terminate keypair """ accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() keypair_page = accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.create_keypair(keypair_name) instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_instances_page() self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.create_instance( **instances_attributes) instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertTrue(instance_status) self.Instance_ip_locator = instances_page.associate_floatingip() instance_ip_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_ip_locator) self.assertTrue(instance_ip_status) self.instance_ip_locator = instances_page.disassociate_floating_ip() instance_ip_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.instanceip_locator) self.assertFalse(instance_floating_ip_status) self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.terminate_instance() instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertFalse(instance_status) accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.delete_keypair(keypair_name) self.assertFalse(keypair_page.get_keypair_status(keypair_name)) def test_edit_instance(self): """tests edit instance: * Creates keypair * Creates and verifies Instance * Edit Instance and verifies * Terminates and verifies Instance * Terminates keypair """ accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() keypair_page = accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.create_keypair(keypair_name) instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_instances_page() self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.create_instance( **instances_attributes) instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertTrue(instance_status) self.edit_Instance_check_locator = instances_page.edit_instance() edit_instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.edit_Instance_check_locator) self.assertTrue(edit_instance_status) self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.terminate_instance() instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertFalse(instance_status) accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.delete_keypair(keypair_name) self.assertFalse(keypair_page.get_keypair_status(keypair_name)) def test_pause_instance(self): """tests pause instance: * Creates keypair * Creates and verifies Instance * Pause Instance and verifies * Terminates and verifies Instance * Terminates keypair """ accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() keypair_page = accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.create_keypair(keypair_name) instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_instances_page() self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.create_instance( **instances_attributes) instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertTrue(instance_status) self.instance_power_status = instances_page.pause_instance() self.assertTrue(self.instance_power_status.text == 'Paused') self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.terminate_instance() instance_status = nstances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertFalse(instance_status) accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.delete_keypair(keypair_name) self.assertFalse(keypair_page.get_keypair_status(keypair_name)) def test_soft_reboot_instance(self): """tests soft reboot instance: * Creates keypair * Creates and verifies Instance * Soft Reboot Instance and verifies * Terminates and verifies Instance * Terminates keypair """ accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() keypair_page = accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.create_keypair(keypair_name) instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_instances_page() self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.create_instance( **instances_attributes) instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertTrue(instance_status) self.instance_power_status = instances_page.soft_reboot_instance() self.assertTrue(self.instance_power_status.text == 'Active') self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.terminate_instance() instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertFalse(instance_status) accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.delete_keypair(keypair_name) self.assertFalse(keypair_page.get_keypair_status(keypair_name)) def test_hard_reboot_instance(self): """tests hard reboot instance: * Creates keypair * Creates and verifies Instance * Hard Reboot Instance and verifies * Terminates and verifies Instance * Terminates keypair """ accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() keypair_page = accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.create_keypair(keypair_name) instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_instances_page() self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.create_instance( **instances_attributes) instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertTrue(instance_status) self.instance_power_status = instances_page.hard_reboot_instance() self.assertTrue(self.instance_power_status.text == 'Active') self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.terminate_instance() instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertFalse(instance_status) accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.delete_keypair(keypair_name) self.assertFalse(keypair_page.get_keypair_status(keypair_name)) def test_rebuild_instance(self): """tests rebuild instance: * Creates keypair * Creates and verifies Instance * Rebuild Instance and verifies * Terminates and verifies Instance * Terminates keypair """ accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() keypair_page = accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.create_keypair(keypair_name) instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_instances_page() self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.create_instance( **instances_attributes) instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertTrue(instance_status) self.instance_power_status = instances_page.rebuild_instance() self.assertTrue(self.instance_power_status.text == 'Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda') self.Instance_check_locator = instances_page.terminate_instance() instance_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_check_locator) self.assertFalse(instance_status) accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.delete_keypair(keypair_name) self.assertFalse(keypair_page.get_keypair_status(keypair_name)) def test_terminate_all_instances(self): """tests terminate all instance and verifies""" accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() keypair_page = accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.create_keypair(keypair_name) instances_page = self.home_pg.go_to_instances_page() self.Instance_delete_locator = instances_page.terminate_all_instances() instance_delete_status = instances_page.is_element_present( *self.Instance_delete_locator) self.assertTrue(instance_delete_status) accesssecurity_page = self.home_pg.go_to_accesssecurity_page() accesssecurity_page.go_to_keypair_page() keypair_page.delete_keypair(keypair_name) self.assertFalse(keypair_page.get_keypair_status(keypair_name))

commit_message:
Introduce manila::db class

Current modules[1][2][3] implements a
<component>::db class that is not implemented in manila.

This commit aims to apply here the same logic.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/master/manifests/db.pp
[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-designate/blob/master/manifests/db.pp
[3] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceilometer/blob/master/manifests/db.pp

Change-Id: I803a5eacc7a81854e2bdd715785886c0f6cfbc33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-manila refs/changes/02/208402/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'manila::db' do shared_examples 'manila::db' do context 'with default parameters' do it { is_expected.to contain_manila_config('database/connection').with_value('sqlite:////var/lib/manila/manila.sqlite').with_secret(true) } it { is_expected.to contain_manila_config('database/idle_timeout').with_value('3600') } end context 'with specific parameters' do let :params do { :database_connection => 'mysql://manila:manila@localhost/manila', :database_idle_timeout => '3601', } end it { is_expected.to contain_manila_config('database/connection').with_value('mysql://manila:manila@localhost/manila').with_secret(true) } it { is_expected.to contain_manila_config('database/idle_timeout').with_value('3601') } end context 'with incorrect database_connection string' do let :params do { :database_connection => 'redis://manila:manila@localhost/manila', } end it_raises 'a Puppet::Error', /validate_re/ end end context 'on Debian platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'Debian' } end it_configures 'manila::db' end context 'on Redhat platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'RedHat' } end it_configures 'manila::db' end end

commit_message:
Introduce ironic::db class

Current modules[1][2][3] implements a
<component>::db class that is not implemented in ironic.

This commit aims to apply here the same logic.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/master/manifests/db.pp
[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-designate/blob/master/manifests/db.pp
[3] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceilometer/blob/master/manifests/db.pp

Change-Id: I62fc13c749ff801daa7fb9701d4c12646272e1a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/81/208381/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'ironic::db' do shared_examples 'ironic::db' do context 'with default parameters' do it { is_expected.to contain_ironic_config('database/connection').with_value('sqlite:////var/lib/ironic/ovs.sqlite') } it { is_expected.to contain_ironic_config('database/idle_timeout').with_value('3600') } it { is_expected.to contain_ironic_config('database/max_retries').with_value('10') } it { is_expected.to contain_ironic_config('database/retry_interval').with_value('10') } end context 'with specific parameters' do let :params do { :database_connection => 'mysql://ironic:ironic@localhost/ironic', :database_idle_timeout => '3601', :database_max_retries => '11', :database_retry_interval => '11', } end it { is_expected.to contain_ironic_config('database/connection').with_value('mysql://ironic:ironic@localhost/ironic') } it { is_expected.to contain_ironic_config('database/idle_timeout').with_value('3601') } it { is_expected.to contain_ironic_config('database/max_retries').with_value('11') } it { is_expected.to contain_ironic_config('database/retry_interval').with_value('11') } end context 'with incorrect database_connection string' do let :params do { :database_connection => 'redis://ironic:ironic@localhost/ironic', } end it_raises 'a Puppet::Error', /validate_re/ end end context 'on Debian platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'Debian' } end it_configures 'ironic::db' end context 'on Redhat platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'RedHat' } end it_configures 'ironic::db' end end

commit_message:
Add hooks for external install & svc management

This adds defined anchor points for external modules to hook into the
software install, config and service dependency chain.  This allows
external modules to manage software installation (virtualenv,
containers, etc) and service management (pacemaker) without needing rely
on resources that may change or be renamed.

Change-Id: I032ee01505e0cbc125b0e219c436b77c93f57720

commit_message:
Update ceilometer::db class to match other module pattern

This review aims to update the ceilometer::db class to standardize it with the
other modules db classes[1][2]. It now offers the same parameters to customize database
connection behavior.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-neutron/blob/master/manifests/db.pp
[2]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-sahara/blob/master/manifests/db.pp

Change-Id: Ic5ca33f862da300f4f429524ba488568d0608cf3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/79/227179/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # == Class: ceilometer::db # [*database_connection*] # Url used to connect to database. # (Optional) Defaults to 'mysql://ceilometer:ceilometer@localhost/ceilometer'. # # [*database_idle_timeout*] # Timeout when db connections should be reaped. # (Optional) Defaults to 3600. # # [*database_min_pool_size*] # Minimum number of SQL connections to keep open in a pool. # (Optional) Defaults to 1. # # [*database_max_pool_size*] # Maximum number of SQL connections to keep open in a pool. # (Optional) Defaults to 10. # # [*database_max_retries*] # Maximum db connection retries during startup. # Setting -1 implies an infinite retry count. # (Optional) Defaults to 10. # # [*database_retry_interval*] # Interval between retries of opening a sql connection. # (Optional) Defaults to 10. # # [*database_max_overflow*] # If set, use this value for max_overflow with sqlalchemy. # (Optional) Defaults to 20. $database_connection = 'mysql://ceilometer:ceilometer@localhost/ceilometer', $database_idle_timeout = 3600, $database_min_pool_size = 1, $database_max_pool_size = 10, $database_max_retries = 10, $database_retry_interval = 10, $database_max_overflow = 20, $sync_db = true, $mysql_module = undef, require 'mysql::bindings' require 'mysql::bindings::python' 'database/connection': value => $database_connection, secret => true; 'database/idle_timeout': value => $database_idle_timeout; 'database/min_pool_size': value => $database_min_pool_size; 'database/max_retries': value => $database_max_retries; 'database/retry_interval': value => $database_retry_interval; 'database/max_pool_size': value => $database_max_pool_size; 'database/max_overflow': value => $database_max_overflow;
deleted_lines: # [*database_connection*] # the connection string. format: [driver]://[user]:[password]@[host]/[database] $database_connection = 'mysql://ceilometer:ceilometer@localhost/ceilometer', $sync_db = true, $mysql_module = undef, include ::mysql::bindings::python Package<| title == 'python-mysqldb' |> -> Class['ceilometer::db'] 'database/connection': value => $database_connection, secret => true;

commit_message:
Introduce gnocchi::db class

Current modules[1][2][3] implements a
<component>::db class that is not implemented in gnocchi.

This commit aims to apply here the same logic.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/master/manifests/db.pp
[2]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-designate/blob/master/manifests/db.pp
[3]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceilometer/blob/master/manifests/db.pp

Change-Id: I9bd224740740c3e587f4ae2c5e645d2ad5db98ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-gnocchi refs/changes/64/208364/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'gnocchi::db' do shared_examples 'gnocchi::db' do context 'with default parameters' do it { is_expected.to contain_gnocchi_config('database/connection').with_value('sqlite:////var/lib/gnocchi/gnocchi.sqlite') } it { is_expected.to contain_gnocchi_config('database/idle_timeout').with_value('3600') } end context 'with specific parameters' do let :params do { :database_connection => 'mysql://gnocchi:gnocchi@localhost/gnocchi', :database_idle_timeout => '3601', } end it { is_expected.to contain_gnocchi_config('database/connection').with_value('mysql://gnocchi:gnocchi@localhost/gnocchi') } it { is_expected.to contain_gnocchi_config('database/idle_timeout').with_value('3601') } end context 'with incorrect database_connection string' do let :params do { :database_connection => 'redis://gnocchi:gnocchi@localhost/gnocchi', } end it_raises 'a Puppet::Error', /validate_re/ end end context 'on Debian platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'Debian' } end it_configures 'gnocchi::db' end context 'on Redhat platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'RedHat' } end it_configures 'gnocchi::db' end end

commit_message:
Fix inconsistency in DHCPv6 hosts and options generation

The DHCP agent is inconsistent in how it handles subnets whose
ipv6_address_mode is not slaac.  While the DHCP agent writes out both
DHCPv6 host entries and DHCPv6 options for ports scoped by the subnet
for dnsmasq to use, subnet specific options are not written.

This patch addresses this inconsistency by generating subnet specific
options when the subnet's ipv6_address_mode is not slaac.

Closes-Bug: #1501451

Change-Id: I372c93fa5667e955c7b81181daa2e66f47d85fdf
(cherry picked from commit 81c5e511f704861a08f2e3938edca97474d4c44c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/64/235864/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

When setup_networks_on_host fails during
rollback_live_migration_at_destination some resources are
left because driver.rollback_live_migration_at_destination is not
called.

To give the driver a chance to cleanup resources, the network method
is wrapped with a try/except block so we can attempt the rollback
via the virt driver.

The first exception that occurs is saved off and raised at the end.

Closes-Bug: #1488435

commit_message:
Attempt rollback live migrate at dest even if network dealloc fails

When setup_networks_on_host fails during
rollback_live_migration_at_destination some resources are
left because driver.rollback_live_migration_at_destination
is not called.

To give driver a chance to cleanup resources,the network
method is wrapped with a try/except block so we can
attempt the rollback via the virt driver.

Closes-bug: #1488435

Change-Id: I463fa28fe05cf44dc335fe02f6c54d9b0a20d1e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/227897/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: # NOTE(tr3buchet): tear down networks on destination host self.network_api.setup_networks_on_host(context, instance, self.host, teardown=True) except Exception: LOG.error(_LE('An error occurred while deallocating network.'), instance=instance, exc_info=True)
deleted_lines: # NOTE(tr3buchet): tear down networks on destination host self.network_api.setup_networks_on_host(context, instance, self.host, teardown=True)

commit_message:
Exclude version 2.6.0 of oslo.util

A recent commit to oslo.util has caused the Trove tests to
break.  This looks to be addressed in a pending change request,
but in the mean time it should be excluded from the requirements.

Probable cause:
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/commit/6010fb3fff11fc

Possible solution:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/230619

Change-Id: I487eae6da833151d8391f27097c4689d573af41f

commit_message:
Enable py3 jobs on networking-cisco

This patch enables python 3 jobs on networking-cisco and makes the
requirements-check non-voting until the cisco requirements are merged
into global requirements successfully.

Change-Id: Ifbecfc6abc0cb3d42e0432ee4783903e41347d66

commit_message:
Redirect on 303 in SAML plugin

The SAML plugin handles redirects in a custom manner but currently only
checks for the 302 redirect code. This doesn't cover the mod_auth_mellon
case which responds with a 303.

Also handle the 303 redirect case.

Change-Id: Idab5f381fcbfb8c561184845d3aa5c8aab142ecd
Closes-Bug: #1501918

commit_message:
fix ceilometermiddleware gate

similar to ceilometerclient[1], ceilometermiddleware gate is broken
because it does not enable ceilometer plugin which is required to
install ceilometermiddleware

[1] Ifa29b42a133a7f8040d72cdd468c650ec486b867

Change-Id: Idb874b433ea9a12d4d0f8dde2ce82d45d8dc976f

commit_message:
Updated the neutron l3HA tool to use v3

The change adds Keystone v3 support to neutron l3 ha tool. This
change is needed to ensure that all l3-ha fail overs are
accomplished correctly.

The tool has been updated to skip / support routers that have
already bene setup using the built in neutron L3HA.

This is something that will need to be backported to Kilo

Change-Id: I94f21ff3fa511bc9da6b57cdf847719620818ece
Closes-Bug: #1499708
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Follow-on for volume list - add tests, clean help

* Add volume list tests for v1 (a copy of the v2 tests)
* Converts volume v2 tests to use Identity v3 so domains can be tested
* Add volume list (v2) tests for new options
* Re-orders volume list options (both v1 and v2) to match
* MArks the new volume list (v2) options as v2-only in doc

Change-Id: I2181b2c48cfde2147d7d0ef135322df8a81e7ce8

commit_message:
Add support for swift-object-expirer service

The swift-object-expirer service was not supported by
puppet-swift. Adding support by creating a new class
(swift::objectexpirer), and its associated custom type/provider.

Change-Id: I498ffe525a7316c0091e4c9d8b7d9658234231f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/49/211549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Swift_config<| |> ~> Service['swift-object-expirer'] service { 'swift-object-expirer': ensure => $service_ensure, name => $::swift::params::object_expirer_service_name, enable => $enabled, provider => $::swift::params::service_provider, require => Package['swift-object'], tag => 'swift-service', }

subject: [Contributor Guide] Editor options section translation to RST
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-19 16:57:15.000000000', 'files': ['doc/contributor-guide/source/first-timers-quickstart.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/17afcd978f187ea0bb68a87e68a77b4ca16987b1', 'message': '[Contributor Guide] Editor options section translation to RST

This patch:

1. Translates the Wiki section about editor options to RST:
    https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/HowTo#Editor_Options
2. Adds links to free RST editor resources.
3. Fixes a typo (comiting -> committing).
4. Adds references to Writing style RST formatting conventions.

Change-Id: I79dd7c5d0115c494c9a2eca35dd9b5063a27da48
'}]
commit_message:
[Contributor Guide] Editor options section translation to RST

This patch:

1. Translates the Wiki section about editor options to RST:
    https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/HowTo#Editor_Options
2. Adds links to free RST editor resources.
3. Fixes a typo (comiting -> committing).
4. Adds references to Writing style RST formatting conventions.

Change-Id: I79dd7c5d0115c494c9a2eca35dd9b5063a27da48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/89/237089/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Use any text editor of your choice to work with the documentation. For example: * To edit **RST** content: * https://wiki.gnome.org/Apps/Gedit * https://wiki.typo3.org/Editors_%28reST%29#Open_source_.28.3D_free_of_cost.29 * To edit **XML** content: * If you prefer Vi, there are ways to make DocBook editing easier: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Editing_DocBook_with_Vi * If you prefer a text-based editor but with validation, you can use Emacs. Here are some resources on DocBook and Emacs' NXML mode: * http://paul.frields.org/2011/02/09/xml-editing-with-emacs/ * https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/How_to_use_Emacs_for_XML_editing * http://infohost.nmt.edu/tcc/help/pubs/nxml/ To keep the documents clean and easy to compare, all the OpenStack projects requirement is that text is wrapped at `79 characters maximum`_, with no white spaces at the end of the line. You can configure the text editor to do that automatically.Committing a change ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Read the :ref:`Writing style <stg_writing_style>` section, also pay attention to the :ref:`RST formatting conventions <rst_conv>` section. #. Create your commit message. See `Committing a change`_ for details... _`Committing a change`: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#committing-a-change
deleted_lines: To keep the documents clean and easy to compare, all OpenStack projects and the Documentation team require is that text is wrapped at `79 characters maximum`_, with no white spaces at the end of the line. It helps to configure the text editor to do that automatically.Commiting a change ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Read the How to contribute to the documentation section, pay attention to the Policies and conventions section, which describes Git commit messages, backport procedures, and other conventions. #. Create your commit message. See `Commiting a change`_ for details... _`Commiting a change`: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#committing-a-change

commit_message:
Add hostname field to JSONFormatter

This change adds 'hostname' field to JSONFormatter.
The field is helpful to distinguish which host sent the logs.

Closes-Bug: #1501232
Change-Id: Ie4ba197543bc8ebd0e22c509a9fe3190069aa5a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log refs/changes/01/229301/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from socket import gethostname self.hostname = gethostname() 'traceback': None, 'hostname': self.hostname}

commit_message:
Raise exception when wrong type is used as default

In I12cd5f4be82ac5ed0ebb348b358dd8eaf04e4e0d the change introduced type
checking of the default value to the Opt and logged a warning. This
change now raises an exception as per the comment in the original
change.

Closes-Bug: #1502072
Change-Id: I9b806efc750009d64b08a5583449bebbf10e3fb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/78/222078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise AttributeError(('Expected default value of type(s) ' '%(extypes)s but got %(default)r of ' 'type %(deftypes)s') % {'extypes': expected_types, 'default': self.default, 'deftypes': type(self.default).__name__})
deleted_lines: # NOTE(tcammann) Change this to raise error after K relase LOG.debug(('Expected default value of type(s) %(extypes)s but got ' '%(default)r of type %(deftypes)s'), {'extypes': expected_types, 'default': self.default, 'deftypes': type(self.default).__name__})

Split out Neutron subnets client

Splitting out a subnets client for Neutron.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

commit_message:
Add reboot_delay option to snmp driver

When node is powered off via "soft off" (during deploy with agent for
example) a off/on cycle is required on external power controller.
If pause between off and on is too short node's hardware unable
to detect external power loss.
This patch adds new 'reboot_delay' config option. Some of
SNMP-enabled power controller have own value for this pause
(configurable or hardcoded). So default value of Ironic option
is "0" for keeping of current behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1506860
Change-Id: I91617f1a296ad38ff4c31872e6e3ac20f8619a38

commit_message:
block oslo.utils version 2.6.0 for liberty

This version of oslo.utils introduced some logic in
forever_retry_uncaught_exceptions method that causes
tests to hang in some situations. There is an up
coming change that resolves this issue when the
next version is released of oslo.utils.

Closes-Bug: #1506402
Depends-On: Id1e58a9db0d277de2f30de54db97040811f40ff2
Change-Id: Ica981756c67902e7fd7bd07ff76c5b679e8e4e2f

subject: Do not map to management partition for NPIV
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-14 18:57:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/05c1dd6879c6c4a9dc745a7472c12ecb818a7519', 'message': 'Do not map to management partition for NPIV

NPIV based deploys attempted to put the client vFC adapters on to the
fabric by creating the WWPNs ahead of time and mapping them to the
management partition.  This created several issues and led to poor
performance.

There were issues around migration:
- Querying for a host could leave a stale adapter on the mgmt partition

There were issues with speed:
- Deploys could take over 120 seconds
- Migrations had additional delays

There were issues with some standard operations:
- Attaching a volume on a powered off VM required logging in the WWPNs

Subsequent analysis in Cinder showed that only some Cinder drivers had
this requirement.  Many could work without this.  Given the challenges
the code is removing the need to log in the WWPNs on the mgmt partition.
This resolves all of the above issues.

While it does limit some of the Cinder drivers when paired with NPIV,
ongoing work will be done to meet with the Cinder driver owners to see
if the requirements in their drivers can be relaxed.

For those that can not, the vSCSI Cinder Volume attach is also an option
and should provide the use cases that they need.

Change-Id: Id77650545ca4e0def9977f1c2572b9f13f451e0d

commit_message:
Do not map to management partition for NPIV

NPIV based deploys attempted to put the client vFC adapters on to the
fabric by creating the WWPNs ahead of time and mapping them to the
management partition.  This created several issues and led to poor
performance.

There were issues around migration:
- Querying for a host could leave a stale adapter on the mgmt partition

There were issues with speed:
- Deploys could take over 120 seconds
- Migrations had additional delays

There were issues with some standard operations:
- Attaching a volume on a powered off VM required logging in the WWPNs

Subsequent analysis in Cinder showed that only some Cinder drivers had
this requirement.  Many could work without this.  Given the challenges
the code is removing the need to log in the WWPNs on the mgmt partition.
This resolves all of the above issues.

While it does limit some of the Cinder drivers when paired with NPIV,
ongoing work will be done to meet with the Cinder driver owners to see
if the requirements in their drivers can be relaxed.

For those that can not, the vSCSI Cinder Volume attach is also an option
and should provide the use cases that they need.

Change-Id: Id77650545ca4e0def9977f1c2572b9f13f451e0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/33/234933/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Will get reused on subsequent loops. # Get a set of WWPNs that are globally unique from the system. v_wwpns = pvm_vfcm.build_wwpn_pair( self.adapter, self.host_uuid, pair_count=self._ports_per_fabric()) port_maps = pvm_vfcm.derive_npiv_map( vios_wraps, self._fabric_ports(fabric), v_wwpns) # VIOS. Seed # them as well. Will get reused on subsequent loops. port_maps = pvm_vfcm.derive_base_npiv_map( vios_wraps, self._fabric_ports(fabric), self._ports_per_fabric()) # VIOS. As a form of multi pathing (so that your paths were # not restricted to a single VIOS). # Check if the fabrics are unmapped then we need to map it # temporarily with the management partition. LOG.info(_LI("Adding NPIV Mapping with mgmt partition for " "instance %s") % self.instance.name) port_maps = pvm_vfcm.add_npiv_port_mappings( self.adapter, self.host_uuid, mgmt_uuid, port_maps) self._set_fabric_state(fabric, FS_MGMT_MAPPED) elif self._is_migration_wwpn(fc_state): # If currently mapped to the mgmt partition, remove the mappings so # that they can be added to the client. if self._get_fabric_state(fabric) == FS_MGMT_MAPPED: mgmt_uuid = mgmt.get_mgmt_partition(self.adapter).uuid # Each port mapping should be removed from the VIOS. for npiv_port_map in npiv_port_maps: vios_w = pvm_vfcm.find_vios_for_port_map(vios_wraps, npiv_port_map) ls = [LOG.info, _LI("Removing NPIV mapping for mgmt partition " "for instance %(inst)s on VIOS %(vios)s."), {'inst': self.instance.name, 'vios': vios_w.name}] # Add the subtask to remove the map from the mgmt partition self.stg_ftsk.wrapper_tasks[vios_w.uuid].add_functor_subtask( pvm_vfcm.remove_maps, mgmt_uuid, port_map=npiv_port_map, logspec=ls) FS_MGMT_MAPPED: Fabric is mapped with the management partition FS_MGMT_MAPPED: Fabric is mapped with the management partition

commit_message:
Cleanup Tacker docs and introduce tox doc test

Deep cleaning of tacker doc/source dir by removing all references
to Neutron, remove non-applicable doc files and various other
fixes and references to Tacker urls. Introduce fixed up HACKING and
CONTRIBUTING docs.

Also add tox 'docs' test run and enable it by default

Change-Id: I90c48eeb3724adb3de3431f1f5464c5200dad071
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/62/235062/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Tacker Style Commandments =========================Tacker Specific Commandments ---------------------------- - [PEP8] When using CamelCase capitalize all the letters in the abbreviation
deleted_lines: Neutron Style Commandments =======================Neutron Specific Commandments -------------------------- - [N320] Validate that LOG messages, except debug ones, have translations All unittest classes must ultimately inherit from testtools.TestCase. In the Neutron test suite, this should be done by inheriting from neutron.tests.base.BaseTestCase. All setUp and tearDown methods must upcall using the super() method. tearDown methods should be avoided and addCleanup calls should be preferred. Never manually create tempfiles. Always use the tempfile fixtures from the fixture library to ensure that they are cleaned up.

commit_message:
Adds rabbitmq-pika-driver spec

This specification contains details about
new RabbitMQ pika driver implementation.

Change-Id: I7bda78820e657b1e97bf888d4065a917eb317cfb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/92/228992/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================================== New RabbitMQ Pika driver implementation ======================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/rabbit-pika This specification proposes new RabbitMQ Pika driver implementation. Problem description =================== Current RabbitMQ oslo.messaging driver uses kombu client library. This library is not supported properly now and RabbitMQ developers recommend to use pika librarty instead. Now pika library supports modern RabbitMQ reatures, like direct reply or heatbeat. Proposed change =============== In this specification I propose to create fully new driver which: #. sould be developed in optimal way regarding to all pika client library new features and best practices; #. should be fully conpatible with current driver interface; #. may change internals and does not guarantee compatibility with kombu driver (means you can not use old kombu driver for some set of services and new pika driver for another services) #. support only current actual features without any deprecated features. Heartbeats ---------- Pika driver has it's own heartbeats mechanism. Alternatives ------------ #. Use old driver; #. Not develop fully new driver, try to just replace client library and keep logic of current driver Impact on Existing APIs ----------------------- None. Security impact --------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Performance should become better because of more optimal implementation. Configuration Impact -------------------- Configuration options should be added to setup pika client library. Developer Impact ---------------- Devstack should be adapted to be able to setup gate test environment with new driver. Testing Impact -------------- Functional tests should be adapted (without changing test logic). Maybe we can extend them by adding some more tricky cases. We also have py27-func-zeromq configuration to run as CI gate job. This gate should be used for the new driver to check it. We also need some kind of multi-node deployment testing. Some HA scenarios testing is also needed. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- dukhlov, yosh-m Primary assignee: dukhlov Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: mitaka Work Items ---------- * Design and implement rpc functionality (send and listen driver methods) based on pika library functionality * Design and implement notify functionality (send_notification and listen_notifications driver methods) based on pika library functionality * Adapt functional tests * Adapt devstack to be able to setup environment with new pika driver Incubation ========== None. Adoption -------- Deployment guide may slightly differ because of some new config options added (e.g. additional ports allocated for each pipeline). It worth noting that during stabilization period both drivers the old and the new one will stay in repos. After stabilization is over the old driver will be deprecated over a standard deprecation path. Library ------- oslo.messaging Anticipated API Stabilization ----------------------------- The new driver should successfully run with adapted devstack. Adapted oslo.messaging functional tests should successfully pass in devstack-gate. Documentation Impact ==================== Detailed doc strings should be written Dependencies ============ pika library References ========== .. [1] https://github.com/dukhlov/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_pika.py .. [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/226348/ .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

commit_message:
Port used limits to core API

Extension 'used limits' was extending core 'limits' API with used
resources information. So, provide such information in core API and
remove extension completely.
It does not require neither update of API router nor bump of
microversion.

Partially implements bp ext-to-core

Change-Id: I0ff71fbd0281eb2e34a9acbfc72ff8c14390e8d9

added_lines: """Builder for absolute limits. For example: {"limit": {"shares": 10, "gigabytes": 1024}, "in_use": {"shares": 8, "gigabytes": 256}}. "limit": { "gigabytes": ["maxTotalShareGigabytes"], "snapshot_gigabytes": ["maxTotalSnapshotGigabytes"], "shares": ["maxTotalShares"], "snapshots": ["maxTotalShareSnapshots"], "share_networks": ["maxTotalShareNetworks"], }, "in_use": { "shares": ["totalSharesUsed"], "snapshots": ["totalShareSnapshotsUsed"], "share_networks": ["totalShareNetworksUsed"], "gigabytes": ["totalShareGigabytesUsed"], "snapshot_gigabytes": ["totalSnapshotGigabytesUsed"], }, for mapping_key in limit_names.keys(): for k, v in absolute_limits.get(mapping_key, {}).items(): if k in limit_names.get(mapping_key, []) and v is not None: for name in limit_names[mapping_key][k]: limits[name] = v
deleted_lines: import six """Builder for absolute limits For example: {"ram": 512, "gigabytes": 1024}. "gigabytes": ["maxTotalShareGigabytes"], "snapshot_gigabytes": ["maxTotalSnapshotGigabytes"], "shares": ["maxTotalShares"], "snapshots": ["maxTotalShareSnapshots"], "share_networks": ["maxTotalShareNetworks"], for name, value in six.iteritems(absolute_limits): if name in limit_names and value is not None: for name in limit_names[name]: limits[name] = value

The docstring for the cherrypick function didn't include the bug
number, which is a required param.  It doesn't appear we're

commit_message:
Fix cherry-pick syntax

The docstring for the cherrypick function didn't include the bug
number, which is a required param.  It doesn't appear we're
actually doing any cherrypicks right now, but at least the docs
can be correct so we'll hopefully get it right in the future.

Change-Id: Ied0f0533383a780e4c40002bdce54d288f99727c

commit_message:
ApiClient now looks for internalURL

instead of retrieving publicURL endpoint for freezer-api, the web ui
looks for the InternalURL to avoid https issues

Change-Id: I2e655c81558c9b382c355927b69116a6c13a455f

commit_message:
Quick fix for backups

backups views now are wrapped in try except block
readme was updated to point to openstack repos
remove sys.path from _50_freezer.py

Change-Id: I917c33a1d8df04173acddc8eecf23f8bf8a22390

commit_message:
Add support for keystone v3 API

This is work in progress: some use cases might not
be working and  spec files are not ready
please don't merge just yet.

Change-Id: Ib41156a3dbf4a5aa05d3028f83d8445f6137d1f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/56/184856/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if res.code.to_i >= 300def keystone_v3_authenticate(auth_url, username, password, tenantId=nil, tenantName=nil) post_args = { 'auth' => { 'identity' => { 'methods' => ["password"], 'password' => { 'user' => { 'name' => username, 'password' => password, 'domain' => { 'id' => 'default'}, }, }, }, }, } if tenantId post_args['auth']['tenantId'] = tenantId end if tenantName post_args['auth']['tenantName'] = tenantName end url = URI.parse("#{auth_url}/auth/tokens") req = Net::HTTP::Post.new url.path req['content-type'] = 'application/json' req.body = post_args.to_json res = neutron_handle_request(req, url) data = JSON.parse res.body return res.to_hash['x-subject-token'] end def keystone_v3_projects(auth_url, token) url = URI.parse("#{auth_url}/projects") req = Net::HTTP::Get.new url.path req['content-type'] = 'application/json' req['x-auth-token'] = token res = neutron_handle_request(req, url) data = JSON.parse res.body data['projects'] end if @resource[:auth_url] =~ /v3/ keystone_v3_authenticate( @resource[:auth_url], @resource[:auth_username], @resource[:auth_password], nil, @resource[:auth_tenant_name] ) else keystone_v2_authenticate( @resource[:auth_url], @resource[:auth_username], @resource[:auth_password], nil, @resource[:auth_tenant_name] ) end if @resource[:auth_url] =~ /v3/ tenants = keystone_v3_projects( @resource[:auth_url], token) else tenants = keystone_v2_tenants( @resource[:auth_url], token) end
deleted_lines: if res.code != '200' keystone_v2_authenticate( @resource[:auth_url], @resource[:auth_username], @resource[:auth_password], nil, @resource[:auth_tenant_name]) tenants = keystone_v2_tenants( @resource[:auth_url], token)
